intro: Echeandia udipratensis, commonly known as the Udipratensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid forests. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a waxy surface. Echeandia udipratensis is noted for its small, inconspicuous flowers that often cluster in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
